metadata.title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in _ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certain Python applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input, as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occurs because sprintf is used unsafely.

notes.note: mdeslaur> on Ubuntu, binaries are compiled with Fortify Source, so exploiting this issue will likely only cause Python to crash, leading to a denial of service.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-4').
python3.9 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.1-3').
